intro: Agalmyla, commonly known as the golden crownbeard, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features showy, yellow ray florets surrounding a central disk of smaller, tubular flowers. Agalmyla typically grows in dry, open habitats and is often found in grasslands and shrublands. Its botanical structure supports pollination by insects, making it an important component of its ecosystem.
